episodeTitle: Who Will Win? Showdown Between the True Powers of the Devil Fruit!
episodeTitleJapanese: 勝者はどっち？悪魔の実の能力対決！
episodeTitleRomaji: Shōsha wa Docchi? Akuma no Mi no Nōryoku Taiketsu!
description: Luffy faces off against Buggy the Clown in an epic Devil Fruit showdown. Through a flashback, Buggy's past with Shanks is revealed, showing how he accidentally ate the Bara Bara no Mi. Luffy debuts his Gomu Gomu no Bazooka technique to defeat Buggy and save Orange Town.

events.title: Buggy and Shanks' Past on the Oro Jackson
events.description: A flashback reveals that young Buggy and Shanks served together as apprentices on the same pirate ship, the Oro Jackson. They are shown arguing about which pole is colder, establishing their long-standing rivalry and friendship.
events.significance: This flashback establishes the deep history between Buggy and Shanks, revealing they both served under the same legendary crew. It provides crucial context for Buggy's resentment toward Shanks and foreshadows the importance of their former captain.

quotes.speaker: Buggy
quotes.context: Young Buggy arguing with Shanks on the Oro Jackson

quotes.text: No way, the South Pole is way colder!
quotes.speaker: Shanks
quotes.context: Young Shanks arguing back with Buggy

events.title: Silvers Rayleigh's First Appearance
events.description: Silvers Rayleigh appears for the first time in the flashback aboard the Oro Jackson, observing young Buggy and Shanks' argument. His identity as first mate of the Roger Pirates is not yet revealed but becomes crucial later.
events.significance: This is the first appearance of one of the most important characters in the series - the Dark King Rayleigh, who will later become Luffy's Haki teacher. His presence hints at the legendary nature of the crew Buggy and Shanks served on.

events.title: How Buggy Obtained the Bara Bara no Mi
events.description: The flashback reveals that Buggy discovered a treasure map and planned to steal a Devil Fruit to sell for 100,000,000 Belly. He ate a fake Devil Fruit in front of the crew while hiding the real Bara Bara no Mi. However, Shanks surprised him, causing Buggy to accidentally swallow the real Devil Fruit.
events.significance: This explains Buggy's grudge against Shanks and reveals the accidental nature of how Buggy gained his powers. It also shows Buggy's cunning nature even as a young pirate and establishes his mercenary motivations.

quotes.text: I was going to sell that Devil Fruit for 100 million Belly!
quotes.speaker: Buggy
quotes.context: Buggy explaining his original plan before accidentally eating the fruit

events.title: Buggy Loses His Treasure Map
events.description: After accidentally eating the Bara Bara no Mi, Buggy's treasure map is blown overboard by the wind. Unable to swim due to the Devil Fruit curse, Buggy cannot retrieve it, losing both his ability to swim and his treasure in one moment.
events.significance: This traumatic moment establishes Buggy's lifelong obsession with treasure and his deep resentment toward Shanks. The loss of his swimming ability and the treasure map shapes Buggy's character and motivations throughout the series.

quotes.text: My treasure map! I can't swim anymore!
quotes.speaker: Buggy
quotes.context: Buggy's anguish as he watches his treasure map float away

events.title: Final Showdown: Luffy vs Buggy
events.description: The battle between Luffy and Buggy intensifies as both pirates use their Devil Fruit powers to their fullest. Buggy unleashes his Bara Bara Festival technique, sending his body parts flying in all directions to attack Luffy.
events.significance: This represents Luffy's first major Devil Fruit vs Devil Fruit battle, showcasing the strategic thinking required when facing opponents with unique powers.

quotes.speaker: Buggy
quotes.context: Buggy launching his signature technique against Luffy

events.title: Nami's Strategic Brilliance
events.description: Nami demonstrates her cunning by stealing Buggy's detached body parts and tying them together in a bag, rendering him unable to reassemble and leaving him vulnerable to Luffy's attacks.
events.significance: This showcases Nami's intelligence and strategic value to the crew, proving she's more than just a thief. Her quick thinking turns the tide of battle and demonstrates how teamwork can overcome powerful Devil Fruit users.

events.title: Gomu Gomu no Bazooka Debut
events.description: Luffy debuts his Gomu Gomu no Bazooka technique for the first time, stretching both arms far back and then hurling them forward in a devastating double palm strike that sends Buggy flying out of Orange Town.
events.significance: This is one of Luffy's signature finishing moves that becomes a staple throughout the series. The technique demonstrates Luffy's growing mastery of his Devil Fruit powers and his ability to develop new techniques in battle. It ranks as the 5th most popular of Luffy's attacks in fan polls.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy unleashing his new technique to defeat Buggy

events.title: Buggy's Defeat
events.description: Buggy is sent flying out of Orange Town by Luffy's Gomu Gomu no Bazooka, ending the battle. The citizens of Orange Town are freed from Buggy's terror, and peace is restored to the town.
events.significance: This marks Luffy's first victory over a Devil Fruit user and establishes a pattern of Luffy defeating villains who terrorize innocent people. Buggy's defeat liberates Orange Town and allows the Straw Hats to continue their journey.

events.title: Nami Secures Buggy's Treasure
events.description: After Buggy's defeat, Nami successfully secures the treasure she stole from Buggy's hideout, including valuable loot and maps. Among the treasure is a map to the Grand Line.
events.significance: This treasure, particularly the Grand Line map, becomes an important asset for the crew's journey. It also reinforces Nami's role as the crew's treasure hunter and navigator.

events.title: Luffy Donates Treasure to Orange Town
events.description: Despite Nami's protests, Luffy decides to leave 5,000,000 Belly from Buggy's treasure with the citizens of Orange Town to help them rebuild after the destruction caused by Buggy's crew.
events.significance: This selfless act demonstrates Luffy's character and values - he prioritizes helping people over wealth. It shows why people are drawn to follow him and establishes his leadership philosophy. Nami is shocked by this decision, highlighting the difference in their initial motivations.

quotes.text: They need it more than we do.
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy explaining his decision to leave money for the townspeople

events.title: Nami Officially Joins as Navigator
events.description: After witnessing Luffy's character and the crew's adventure in Orange Town, Nami officially agrees to join the Straw Hat Pirates as their navigator, though she initially claims it's only temporary and for the treasure.
events.significance: This is a pivotal moment in the formation of the Straw Hat crew. Nami becomes the third member and the first female member of the crew. Her navigation skills will prove essential for their journey to the Grand Line and beyond.

quotes.text: Fine, I'll join you guys... but only as your navigator!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami agreeing to join the crew

events.title: Departure from Orange Town
events.description: The Straw Hat crew departs from Orange Town as the grateful citizens, led by Mayor Boodle, wave goodbye. The town can now begin rebuilding in peace.
events.significance: This marks the end of the Orange Town Arc and the crew's continuation toward the Grand Line. The peaceful departure contrasts with their violent arrival and shows the positive impact they've had.

quotes.speaker: Boodle
quotes.context: Mayor Boodle expressing gratitude as the crew departs

events.title: Introduction to Gecko Islands
events.description: The episode briefly shifts to show the Gecko Islands, a new location where the next arc will take place. This sets up the crew's next destination.
events.significance: This introduces the setting for the upcoming Syrup Village arc and builds anticipation for the next adventure.

events.title: Usopp's First Appearance
events.description: Usopp makes his debut appearance at the Gecko Islands, shown as a young man telling tall tales to the village children. He declares himself as 'Captain Usopp' and speaks of his brave pirate adventures.
events.significance: This is the first appearance of the future Straw Hat sniper, Usopp. His introduction sets up the next arc and foreshadows his eventual recruitment into Luffy's crew.

quotes.text: I am the great Captain Usopp!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp introducing himself to the village children

events.title: Poro's First Appearance
events.description: Poro, one of the children who listens to Usopp's stories in Syrup Village, appears for the first time.
events.significance: Poro is one of Usopp's young followers and represents the village children who look up to Usopp despite knowing his tendency to lie.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's first use of the Bazooka technique

quotes.text: Fine, I'll join you guys... but only as your navigator!
quotes.speaker: Nami

quotes.text: They need it more than we do.
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Explaining why he's leaving treasure for Orange Town

quotes.text: I was going to sell that Devil Fruit for 100 million Belly!
quotes.speaker: Buggy

themes.description: The flashback explores the complex relationship between Buggy and Shanks, showing how childhood friends can become rivals while still maintaining a connection.
themes.symbolism: The argument about the poles represents their fundamental differences in perspective and values.

themes.description: Luffy's decision to leave treasure for Orange Town contrasts sharply with Buggy's greed and Nami's initial treasure-focused motivations.
themes.symbolism: The donated money represents Luffy's values and the kind of pirate king he aspires to be - one who helps rather than exploits.

themes.description: Buggy's accidental consumption of the Devil Fruit and loss of his treasure map shows how split-second decisions can have lifelong consequences.
themes.symbolism: The treasure map blowing away represents lost opportunities and how greed can lead to greater losses.

themes.description: Nami officially joining the crew marks the growing family that Luffy is building, with each member bringing unique skills and perspectives.
themes.symbolism: The crew's teamwork in defeating Buggy symbolizes the strength found in unity and complementary abilities.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy demonstrates both his combat growth with the Gomu Gomu no Bazooka and his moral character by giving treasure to the townspeople. This episode solidifies his role as a different kind of pirate.
keyActions: Debuts Gomu Gomu no Bazooka technique
Defeats Buggy and saves Orange Town
Donates 5,000,000 Belly to help rebuild the town
Welcomes Nami as the crew's navigator
quotes: They need it more than we do.

characterSpotlights.development: Buggy's backstory is revealed, showing his past with Shanks and how he obtained his Devil Fruit. This adds depth to his character beyond being a simple villain and establishes his long-running grudge.
keyActions: Reveals his past with Shanks through flashback
Is defeated and sent flying out of Orange Town
quotes: I was going to sell that Devil Fruit for 100 million Belly!

characterSpotlights.development: Nami officially commits to joining the crew as navigator, though she maintains her focus on treasure. Her strategic thinking proves valuable in helping defeat Buggy.
keyActions: Steals Buggy's body parts and ties them up
Secures Buggy's treasure and Grand Line map
Officially joins the Straw Hat Pirates as navigator
quotes: Fine, I'll join you guys... but only as your navigator!

characterSpotlights.development: The flashback provides more context about Shanks' past, showing him as a young pirate apprentice alongside Buggy and establishing his connection to a legendary crew.
keyActions: Appears in flashback arguing with young Buggy
Accidentally causes Buggy to swallow the Bara Bara no Mi
quotes: No way, the South Pole is way colder!

characterSpotlights.development: Usopp is introduced telling stories to children, establishing his character as a liar and storyteller while setting up the next arc.
keyActions: Makes his first appearance in Syrup Village
Tells tall tales to village children
quotes: I am the great Captain Usopp!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expanded the flashback sequence with additional scenes and dialogue to fill episode runtime.
The anime added more detail to the final battle sequence between Luffy and Buggy with extended fight choreography.

trivia.fact: This is the final episode of the Orange Town Arc, which spans episodes 4-8.
Gomu Gomu no Bazooka ranks as the 5th most popular of Luffy's techniques in fan polls, with 995 votes.

sources.title: Gomu Gomu no Mi Techniques - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Silvers Rayleigh makes his first appearance in this episode, though his identity as the Dark King is not revealed until much later in the series.
This episode aired on December 29, 1999, making it the last One Piece episode of the 20th century.
The episode covers manga chapters 19-21 from Volume 3.
The original broadcast had a 12.3% rating, while the 2012 remastered version had a 5.2% rating.
